recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model and its constructs.
- Assumption of trustless out-of-band payments is deemed unrealistic and compromises Bitcoin's security.
- Bitcoin's security relies on maintaining nash equilibrium between miners, disincentivized from censorship.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP has been updated to include a DH cryptosystem in BIP 21.
- The change was made based on Adam's comments to ensure a secure experience.
- The focus is on maintaining security while allowing an easy user experience.

- QR code density is doubled when either base64 or UR encoding is used.

recent_posts.title: Backing up channel state with counterparties
recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes revisiting the post-PTLCs scenario and implementing MPP for classic keysend.
- CLN and LDK already support this feature, and it should be adopted by others.
- The recipient's decision to claim less doesn't affect the sender's considered payment.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains with server blinded.
- Blinded statechains rely on trusting server to report partial signatures.
- In blinding, key and nonce aggregation are performed by party 2.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- The Ark protocol is a new second-layer design alternative to the Lightning network.
- Ark allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints, using virtual UTXOs.
- An untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider enables anonymous, off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets are not permanent and can be compromised or lost, leading to toxic data.
- Silent Payments allow safe multiple payments to one address, but should eventually expire.
- Solution: Add 3-byte field encoding expiration date to addresses, defaulting to 1 year.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- This plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially limiting accessibility.
- Privacy and decentralization are compromised if users are forced to route payments through regulated hubs.
